Ask HN: Is there any way to stop ChatGPT from lying?
text: I spent hours feeding ChatGPT documentation on a programming language framework and providing it with detailed instructions for answering questions. I specifically told it to only provide an answer if it had learned the information during our conversation, and to reply "I haven't learned about that from you yet" if it was not familiar with the topic. Despite these instructions and numerous reminders, it continued to generate false information that had no relation to our conversation. It appeared to be inferring or extrapolating, but ended up fabricating nonsense that seemed accurate but was actually incorrect. Is it possible to prevent this behavior through prompts, or will ChatGPT always mix false information with true information?

Ask HN: Anyone in Melbourne willing to lend me an RTX 4090/4080 for one day?
text:
I know this is a long shot, but is there anyone in Melbourne, Australia willing to lend me an RTX 4080 or RTX 4090 for a day so I can test my software with it?

I don't know how you'd address the question of trust - i.e. me not running off with your card, but I'm open to any ideas for solving to that.

No doubt you know an RTX 4090/4080 costs > $2,500 and I just don't have the money to be buying cards to test on, so hoping to find someone kind enough to help out.

Email address is here: https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=andrewstuart

title: AI tool to extract and cite important information from medical research
text:
MyFirstDraft tool is particularly useful for researchers and healthcare professionals who need to keep up with the latest developments in their field. With the vast amount of research being published on a daily basis, it can be overwhelming to try to stay on top of everything. AI can help by automatically extracting key information from research papers and organizing it in a way that is easy to access and understand.

One of the benefits of using an AI tool for information extraction is that it can save a lot of time and effort. Rather than manually sifting through papers to find relevant information, an AI tool can do this quickly and accurately. This leaves researchers with more time to focus on analyzing the information and drawing insights from it.
